The claim was published on Facebook on S: 2020, and was shared more than 11,000 times before it was deleted.
The Sinhala: language text superimposed on the image translates to English as: “Cattle slaughter has been banned in Sri Lanka with effect from today. Thank you.”
A similar claim was also shared on Faceb: 4. The spokesperson from the Prime Minister’s Office confirmed that the ban on cattle slaughter had not become law and that it was still under discussion and would require input from various groups.
